explanation:
Ezra was apriest and scribewho played a key role in therebuilding of the Temple in Jerusalemafter the Babylonian exile. Under the decree ofKing Cyrus of Persia, the exiled Jews were allowed to return to Jerusalem and rebuild the Temple, which had been destroyed by the Babylonians in 586 BCE.
Ezra led a group of exiles back to Jerusalem and worked to restore the religious and social order of the Jewish people, ensuring that they followed theLaw of Moses. His efforts, along with those ofNehemiah, helped to re-establish Jewish worship and governance in the post-exilic period.

Why according to Paul must Christians be subject to civil authority?

options.D: it is an Old Testament Law

explanation:
Romans 13: 1-4 (RSV):
Let every person be subject to the governing authorities. For there is no authority except from God, and those that exist have been instituted by God. 2 Therefore he who resists the authorities resists what God has appointed, and those who resist will incur judgment. 3 For rulers are not a terror to good conduct, but to bad. Would you have no fear of him who is in authority? Then do what is good, and you will receive his approval, 4 for he is God’s servant for your good.But if you do wrong, be afraid, for he does not bear the sword in vain; he is the servant of God to execute his wrath on the wrongdoer. 5 Therefore one must be subject, not only to avoid God’s wrath but also for the sake of conscience.
